snippet: A look at the economic policies of five New York City mayors, a thriller about a torturer and a graphic novel about Jewish immigrants on the Lower East Side.
abstract: Sam Roberts reviews books Modern New York: The Life and Economics of a City by Greg David, The Inquisitor by Mark Allen Smith and Unterzakhn by Leela Corman.
lead_paragraph: A look at the economic policies of five New York City mayors, a thriller about a torturer and a graphic novel about Jewish immigrants on the Lower East Side.

headline.main: New York Economics, Inquisitions and Immigrants
